port.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a place where ships can be loaded and unloaded
port.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The ferry was about to leave port.
We’ll have two days ashore while the ship is in port.
port.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a town or city with a harbour or docks where ships can be loaded or unloaded
port.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a part of a computer where you can connect another piece of equipment, such as a printer
port.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: strong sweet Portuguese wine that is usually drunk after a meal
port.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: the left side of a ship or aircraft when you are looking towards the front
port.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: Hong Kong is one of the world’s busiest ports.
The city became a major port.
Until the 1870s, Port Albert was a bustling port.
The town is Iceland's biggest fishing port.
Hamburg is one of Europe's main container ports.
Dover is an important ferry port.
Many shops remain open on a Sunday, especially if cruise ships are in port.
We stood on the quay and watched the ships come into port.
Two fishing boats were preparing to leave port.
port.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: port
a place where ships can be loaded and unloaded
a busy port
We’ll have two days ashore while the ship is in port.
The ferry was about to leave port.
harbour
an area of water next to the land which is protected by walls so the water is calm, and is a place where ships can stay when they are not sailing
They sailed into Portsmouth Harbour
Tourist boats leave the harbour at Riva regularly.
the harbour wall
dock
a place in a port where ships are loaded, unloaded, or repaired
A crowd was waiting at the dock to greet them.
The ship was in dock for repairs.
pier
a structure that is built over and into the water so that boats can stop next to it or people can walk along it
The yacht was moored at a pier.
jetty
a wall or platform built out into the water, used for getting on and off boats
a wooden jetty
The house has a private jetty.
mooring
the place where a ship or boat is fastened to the land or to the bottom of the sea
Tugs towed the boat away from its mooring at White Bay.
marina
a harbour where people keep boats which are used for pleasure
They are building a new 220-berth marina.
The apartments have a private marina.
port.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to move software from one computer system to another
port.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Can Windows applications be ported to Unix?
port.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a place where ships can load and unload people or things, or a town or city that has one of these places
port.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Inspectors were holding up grain exports at Canadian ports.
Port officials reported huge losses on port operations last year.
The cargo can leave port immediately.
port.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: a part of a computer where you can connect another piece of equipment such as a printer
port.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: The unit plugs into the printer port of your PC.
port.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to run software on another computer system without changing it in any way
port.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Can Windows applications be ported to Unix?
